content:
Sure, here are some notable quotes by Søren Kierkegaard:

1. “Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.”
2. “The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.”
3. “People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use.”
4. “Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.”
5. “The most common form of despair is not being who you are.”
6. “Truth is a subjectivity.”
7. “Once you label me, you negate me.”
8. “The self is a relation that relates itself to its own self, or it is that in the relation that the relation relates itself to its own self; the self is not the relation but is the relation’s relating itself to itself.”
9. “It is so hard to believe because it is so hard to obey.”
10. “To be human is to be in the world as a self-reflecting and self-transcending being.”
